pages.text: A centrifugal pump is required to move fluids from any fluid apparatus to another.$(br2)A motor must be present behind the pump for it to work. The motor can accept any type of power from the top.$(br2)The pump has a flow rate of 50000 l/h. Multiple pumps in parallel will increase the flow rate, chaining in series is currently not supported.

The front of the pump is the "suck" side where it will suck liquids from all connected apparatus evenly. The top is the "press" side and will move the fluids to all apparatus that are connected to here.$(br2)When an apparatus holds multiple fluids, it's seen as a mixture, so they will all be moved evenly in proportion.$(br2)The motor is redstone toggleable, the sensor receiver can be used directly on the motor.

$(#ff0000)$(l)Plant design challenge:$()$(br)Try designing your plant having all the pumps on the ground level next to each other. This is known as a pump gallery and allows for ease of access and repairability in real life. Have all the apparatus on floors above. This is how most plants in real life are built.
